node.title: Miami Beach officially declares state of emergency after 2 shootings
node.description: Five people were injured in the shootings and one person has been arrested, CBS Miami reported.
node.content: ["Miami Beach has officially declared a state of emergency and imposed a midnight curfew through the weekend, the city said Wednesday. The measures come after two shootings in recent days injured five people.\u00a0", "The curfew, which will begin on Thursday and end on Monday, lasts from midnight to 6:00 a.m. each night. Businesses in the area will be closed, and restaurants will be open for delivery only after that time. Essential services will not be impacted, and residents will still be permitted to leave and arrive at their homes.", "City of Miami Beach Issues State of Emergency and Curfew\u2014Curfew to be in effect from Thursday, March 24 until Monday, March 28\u2014 ", "Details: https://t.co/8EADBL18NT pic.twitter.com/9I52VhybxE", "Plans for the curfew and state of emergency were first announced Monday, following two shootings in a 48-hour period that wounded five people total, CBS Miami reported. City officials will meet this week to decide if the curfew should be extended.\u00a0 \u00a0", "\"It is horribly sad that we're standing here for the cowardly acts of random people,\" City Manager Alina Hudak said this week, according to CBS Miami. She said both shootings targeted \"innocent bystanders.\"\u00a0", "\"No community, no police force, should have to suffer through this,\" said Mayor Dan Gelber. \"You know I'm really tired of it, frankly, I'd love to get rid of spring break. I wish the spring breakers would go somewhere else.\"\u00a0", "Miami Beach also declared a state of emergency\u00a0last year after spring break partying turned to chaos.\u00a0 \u00a0", "The first shooting, which occurred on Sunday, sent three people to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries, CBS Miami said. The second, which took place on Monday, injured two women.\u00a0", "\"It was just a shock to hear the gunshots and all of the commotion outside of the window,\" a witness to the Monday shooting told CBS Miami. \"It was like a couple of pow, pow, pows and you heard all of the screaming and everyone saying 'run.'\"", "A 19-year-old was arrested and charged with carrying a concealed firearm and tampering with evidence in connection with the Monday shooting, but the primary suspect has not yet been apprehended, CBS Miami said.\u00a0", "Victoria Albert is a News Editor at CBS News. Reach her at victoria.albert@viacomcbs.com"]
